article:
'Cladding' is the application of one material over another to provide a skin or
layer intended to control the infiltration of weather elements, or for aesthetic
purposes. Fleming, et al., The Penguin Dictionary of Architecture, p.76
(1980) Cladding does not necessarily have to provide a water-proof
condition but is instead a control element. This control element may only serve
to safely direct water or wind in order to control run-off and prevent
infiltration into the building structure. Cladding applied to windows is often
referred to as window capping and is a very specialized field.
